article.description: LIU Brooklyn edges past Robert Morris 63-62
article.headline: LIU Brooklyn edges past Robert Morris 63-62
article.linkText: LIU Brooklyn edges past Robert Morris 63-62
article.story: TOWNSHIP, Pa. -- Martin Hermannsson scored 12 points -- all in the second half -- and made two free throws for the win, pushing LIU Brooklyn over Robert Morris 63-62 on Thursday night. Hermannsson hit a pair of free throws to give LIU Brooklyn a 63-62 advantage with 1:19 remaining. Joel Hernandez got an offensive board, a steal on the other end, and blocked a shot attempt with less than a second left to seal the win. Robert Morris (12-13, 8-5 Northeast Conference) led 40-30 at intermission, but LIU Brooklyn's defense in the second half made all the difference. The Blackbirds (11-13, 7-6) held Robert Morris to 25-percent shooting after the break, making 52.6 percent by comparison. Marcquise Reed scored 14 points to lead the Colonials, who dropped into a third-place tie in the conference after the loss.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.
